Class PersonalSchedule

java.lang.Object
userInfo.PersonalSchedule
public class PersonalSchedule extends Object
Represents a doctor's personal schedule and provides methods for managing and viewing their schedule. The schedule consists of 7 days (Monday to Sunday), each with 16 time slots. Each time slot can be marked as Free (F) or assigned to a specific task such as meetings, surgical operations, etc.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PersonalSchedule(String doctorID)
    Constructs a PersonalSchedule object for a specific doctor based on the provided doctorID.

  • Constructor Details

    • PersonalSchedule

      public PersonalSchedule(String doctorID)
      Constructs a PersonalSchedule object for a specific doctor based on the provided doctorID. Initializes the schedule with data read from a CSV file, setting each time slot to 'F' (Free) initially.
      Parameters:
      doctorID - the ID of the doctor whose schedule is being initialized

  • Method Details

    • editSchedule

      public void editSchedule(int day, int startTime, int endTime, Object task)
      Edits the schedule by assigning a task to a specific time range.
      Parameters:
      day - the day of the week (0 = Monday, 6 = Sunday)
      startTime - the starting time slot
      endTime - the ending time slot
      task - the task to assign (e.g., 'M' for meeting, 'S' for surgery)

    • translateSchedule

      public String translateSchedule()
      Translates the schedule into a string representation suitable for saving or displaying. The translation lists day, start time, end time, and task for each task block.
      Returns:
      the string representation of the schedule

    • viewSchedule

      public void viewSchedule()
      Displays the current schedule, showing each day's tasks in a time slot grid. It labels each task with a specific character code (e.g., 'M' for meeting, 'S' for surgery, etc.).

    • slotsAreFree

      public boolean slotsAreFree(int day, int startTime, int endTime)
      Checks if the given time range is free for a specific day.
      Parameters:
      day - the day of the week (0 = Monday, 6 = Sunday)
      startTime - the starting time slot
      endTime - the ending time slot
      Returns:
      true if the time range is free, false otherwise

    • viewFreeSlots

      public void viewFreeSlots()
      Displays the available slots for appointment booking from the next day until the end of the week. Available slots are marked as 'O', and unavailable slots are marked as '-'.
